definition: located on a side, an extended outer surface of an object, take sides for or against
details:
adjective
- located on a side
noun
- an extended outer surface of an object
= example: an extended outer surface of an object
- either the left or right half of a body
= example: either the left or right half of a body
- an aspect of something, as contrasted with some other implied aspect
= example: an aspect of something, as contrasted with some other implied aspect
- an opinion that is held in opposition to another in an argument or dispute
= example: an opinion that is held in opposition to another in an argument or dispute
= synonyms: position
- (sports) the spin given to a ball by striking it on one side or releasing it with a sharp twist
= synonyms: English
- a lengthwise dressed half of an animal's carcass used for food
= synonyms: side of meat
- a family line of descent
= example: a family line of descent
- one of two or more contesting groups
= example: one of two or more contesting groups
- a surface forming part of the outside of an object
= example: a surface forming part of the outside of an object
= synonyms: face
- a line segment forming part of the perimeter of a plane figure
= example: a line segment forming part of the perimeter of a plane figure
- a place within a region identified relative to a center or reference location
= example: a place within a region identified relative to a center or reference location
- an elevated geological formation
= synonyms: incline
verb
- take sides for or against
